posts.content:
Hi folks, another CP owner - although mine's only the interior!
I'm slowly fitting it into a '65 LHD bus, and am watching the threads with interest, as Omi says -they seem to differ quite a lot.
My question - have got an original door canopy with long straps that go over the roof to the rain gutter the opposite side - what do they fit into, or onto? Any pics or details would be great,

Graham

Hi,

Yes your canopy was obviously for the non pop top version. The long straps went to each corner as you say and then were held in place by a small L shaped pin then went through a drilled hole in the corners of the rain gutters.

One version I saw had a threaded pin with small nuts either side to keep them in place. To be honest from the original picture I have, you cannot tell the detail of this pin.

I have a non pop top too but have had another canopy made with similar thin stripe material but in green (from Dormobile). As the bus did not have a Pitt interior and I loathed to drill holes in the gutters, I decided to make it fit to the gutter above the doors as some other after market canopies on the market.

Choice is yours!

O.

Mine has these cleats for what I assume is a canvas cover over the cargo doors.

Does anyone have a pic showing this set up on a pop top bus?

Do you have the door canopy? I'm assuming not. The canopy has eyelets on the back piece that mate up with and snap over the studs sticking out from the aluminium rail in the photo. I'll see if I can get one pic for you.

O.

Bobley posted a picture of this CP van door awning peg in the gutter that was found as his CP body was being prepped...

which is here...
viewtopic.php?f=6&t=25506&hilit=canterbury. .
He went on to fit a repro devon interior and nice it is too..

but whilst looking for it I found a thread about a CP...have you seen this..as reference pictures...


viewtopic.php?f=2&t=25609&hilit=canterbury

Do you have bunk mount brackets?

Thanks omi-wan, if you can put up a pic that would be appreciated - the puzzle is startingto come together

Also, thanks to type21f for the links. OP's '65 CP has helped we work out how my interior should be
I did know where there were three CP bunk supports if you are missing any, but I think the owner did not advertise because there were only three? If these are needed....

Thanks T21!
They're the pins / pegs I had in mind - I remember seeing them on the shell my interior came from. As the awning straps just have brass eyelets (not poppers) does any one know if there are seperate caps, or does the strap just hang on by tension?

Graham

The pegs go with dot poppers as you say. The brass eyelets may be several different things.
On Devons they use turnbuckles inside..
If you look on the woolies trim site you may see what you want?
http://www.woolies-trim.co.uk/
here?
http://www.woolies-trim.co.uk/c-52-hood-fasteners.aspx
If not, post a picture and a CP buff may well clarify...

morts wrote:Mine has these cleats for what I assume is a canvas cover over the cargo doors.

Does anyone have a pic showing this set up on a pop top bus?




I'm looking for x3 of these pin thing-a-me-jiggies
does anyone know where I can find some ??????

Yes...but I would have to get permission from the picture owner...
You know who owns the picture!

I think you have had conversations with him..
perhaps he will post a picture?

Please?

OOPS I think woolies sell them..
I will hunt for the link again...OOPS I posted it already above...see if that works
It does...

LOL
i had to go and buy a CP canopy, just so I could take my own pictures of one

Good aren't they though...
I want a green and white one..So after buying three red and white ones...I still want a green and white one!
I intend to butcher it and fit a sliding edge to use the Devon rail which is outside the Gentlux pop top..

any way Woolies sell the (males) pegs and the females....
